item.title: Popcorn
item.description: Popcorn program is the only money earning activity once a year allows the Scouts to raise funds to pay their own way through scouting, including summer camps, equipment, and other experience. Scout with the help of Registered Adult Partner creates an account in Trail’s End and co-ordinate with the Pack Popcorn chair to participate in the program. Logistics for Popcorn program: Create account in Train’s End. Signup for the shifts (Max 2 per Scout) in Trail’s End.

item.title: Tiger
item.description: Ist Grade/6Y subscribe p499-tigers for Pack-499 resources

item.title: Pinewood Derby
item.description: Register here by Dec 20th to confirm your participation! Since it was first introduced in 1953 by Don Murphy, a Cubmaster in California, Pine Wood Derby(PWD) has become one of the most popular and favorite activity for cubscouts. It is one of the most celebrated tradition in Cubscouts. Pack499 had a blasting performance in 2022 with multiple awards in various categories. PWD is about creativity, innovation and parent/caregiver - scout collaboration span multiple weeks to build a car from a single piece of derby and compete among the cubscouts.

item.title: Wolf
item.description: 2nd Grade/7Y | subscribe p499-wolves for Pack-499 resources About Wolf Den | Requirements BobCat Badge Resources (Done!) Adventure 1: Call of the Wild [Inprogerss] 7 basic Knots Wolves learn Overhand and Square knots only. Adventure 2: Council Fire (Duty to Country) [Not started] Adventure 3: Duty to God Footsteps [Inprogress] Adventure 4: Howling at the Moon [Not started] Adventure 5: Paws on the path [Inprogress] Cubscout Six Essentials Adventure 6: Running With the Pack [Not started]

item.title: About
item.description: We gather twice a month at SBIA to help the scouts learning lifeskills in a safe and fun filled environment.

item.title: Adult Leader Contributions
item.description: 1. Onboard/Register (new/renew) Get familiar about cubscouts. Here are some useful links. Create account in scouting.org*. Complete Youth Protection Training*. Complete AB-506 VOLUNTEER PROCESS*. Attend position specific training. Complete the Leader Onboarding Process. It sounds overwhelming, but most of it is a one-time activity and the content is very useful. Do not try to do all of it in a day or in a single sitting. It take time and so plan accordingly.

item.title: Registration
item.description: Registrations are open for year 2023-2024. Contact us with the below details.

item.title: Training for adults
item.description: All registered adult leaders and the volunteering adults must complete YPT and maintain ACTIVE status through out the scouting.
